title: Economy
content:
America seeks global backing against China's rare earth export curbs. Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent expects support from India and European democracies. China's actions are seen as provocative. Former President Donald Trump previously threatened tariffs. China dominates rare earth mining and processing. The US has imposed tariffs on India.

The International Monetary Fund has increased India's economic growth forecast for the fiscal year 2026 to 6.6 percent. This positive outlook comes despite recent US tariffs on Indian goods. India is projected to achieve the highest growth rate among advanced economies, emerging markets, and developing countries for the current and next fiscal years.
